author: Charles Passy
title: The Met’s New Music Director Will Start Ahead of Schedule
text:
Yannick Nézet-Séguin, the conductor slated to become the Metropolitan Opera’s new music director starting in the 2020-21 season, instead will assume his duties starting this fall, the company announced Thursday.
Mr. Nézet-Séguin, 42 years old, was originally tapped for a designate position during the 2018-19 and 2019-20 seasons. In taking on the full role ahead of schedule, the Canadian-born maestro will conduct additional operas and concerts, plus assume the broad array of artistic responsibilities that comes with running...
